‚ÄúLittle Europe‚Äù in Tecumseh
As a British Citizen but Resident Alien living in Manchester Michigan for the past 32 years we have been remodeling our turn-of-the-century farmhouse and every room is under some construction, needs fixes, and is a serious trip hazard. Plus, August at our house is bat month when these flying rodents somehow escape the attic and explore the house! After two months of this combination of challenges, I needed a break. So, I thought that getting a nearby Airbnb for a night would be the tonic for a hazard-free, stress-free, bat-free, break. Airbnbs are all around and what sounded enticing was the French Studio in nearby Tecumseh, half a block along Chicago Street from Tecumseh Brewing, which I already frequent. Perfect. Erika, a super-host, with her husband John let these ‚ÄúEuropean studios‚Äù (I believe there are six or so) are each styled after a particular European country. The French Studio for France, Italian for Italy etc. Climbing up a long steep flight of stairs nestled about halfway down the corridor was the French Studio. Entering you really do feel like you are in France, Paris actually. The first thing of note is just like Paris hotels and studios, they are small but cozy, sparse but adequate. Europeans may not get the American-style shower, and certainly not the portable air conditioner (Only 1% of British homes have A/C, which in England means to open a window!). Erika‚Äôs studio has this but does not have a dishwasher, just like European Studios. Drawing a richer French picture was the decor, which had touches of French art and symbols such as you would find in Lyon or Nice. As a host, Erika is super responsive to questions and suggestions. But there is more. Beneath the studios is a European cheese and wine shop, with an abundance of imported delicious European cheeses and wine pairings. I am in there like I was on vacation in France spending way too much and s guy walks in placing two just-made Mozzarella balls in a refrigerator. This was John Erika‚Äôs husband who along with her owns and runs the store. Walk a couple of doors down and you come to a British Tea Garden, with a gazillion teas, British fav foods, specialty British food, including cottage pie, beef pasty, and even a Ploughman‚Äôs lunch which can be enjoyed in the cozy British Pantry Tea Garden or rooftop garden caf√©. So, Erika‚Äôs European Studios are at the heart of Tecumseh‚Äôs Little Europe and, like being in Paris or Rome are part of the richer European experience right outside your door. I was transported from my stress into this mini-vacation just 9 miles from the remodeling hell and I recovered ready for a fresh start. Thank you, Erika, for being so friendly and open to suggestions and enhancements.
